item.title: How interest rate hikes could affect your mortgage payment
item.description: Despite the Bank of Canada’s key overnight interest rate target holding steady at 0.25 per cent, the bank has signalled that interest rates are expected to rise, and soon.

item.title: Explainer: How is the Russia-Ukraine war linked to religion?
item.description: Some U.S. Orthodox hope they can put such conflicts aside and unite to try to end the war, while also fearing the war could exacerbate the split.

item.title: How Covid Stole Our Time and How We Can Get It Back

item.title: Why some teams boost motivation while others totally sap it

item.title: How Does Understanding Work? A Look at the Construction-Integration Model of Comprehension
item.description: In this essay, I take a deeper look at Walter Kintsch’s Construction-Integration (CI) theory. This theory uses the process of understanding text as its starting point for a broader view of cognition.

item.title: Members of our species were in Western Europe around 54,000 years ago
item.description: Finding the first Homo sapiens in Europe People lived at Grotte Mandrin, a rock shelter in Southern France’s Rhone Valley, for tens of thousands of years. Until roughly 54,000 years ago, those people were Neanderthals.
item.content:encoded: Finding the first Homo sapiens in Europe People lived at Grotte Mandrin, a rock shelter in Southern France’s Rhone Valley, for tens of thousands of years. Until roughly 54,000 years ago, those people were Neanderthals.

item.title: James Webb Might be Able to Detect Other Civilizations by their Air Pollution
item.description: The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), launched last December, has been slowly powering up its instruments and unfurling its sunshield, and is now in the process of aligning its mirrors in preparation for operation.
item.content:encoded: The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), launched last December, has been slowly powering up its instruments and unfurling its sunshield, and is now in the process of aligning its mirrors in preparation for operation.
item.itunes:author: Matter

item.title: Atomic Clocks Separated by Just a few Centimetres Measure Different Rates of Time. Just as Einstein Predicted
item.description: Time dilation itself is a well-established concept. This isn’t even the first time NIST engineers have proven it using atomic clocks. Conceptually time dilation means gravity itself slows down time.
item.content:encoded: Time dilation itself is a well-established concept. This isn’t even the first time NIST engineers have proven it using atomic clocks. Conceptually time dilation means gravity itself slows down time.
item.itunes:author: Matter
item.itunes:summary: Time dilation itself is a well-established concept. This isn’t even the first time NIST engineers have proven it using atomic clocks. Conceptually time dilation means gravity itself slows down time.

item.title: The Gods Only Have Power Because We Believe In Them
item.description: The gods only have power when people doubt them.” “Then why have they revealed themselves to us?” “Those gods you know of are the weakest of gods, those who let their lust for praise and adoration overcome their good sense.
